title: MacOS 10.15.7: Zooming SVG files with the touchpad (MacBook) doesn't actually resize the picture
content:
Hello!

First, let me tell you that "https://qsurvey.mozilla.com/s3/Give-feedback-landing-page" "https://qsurvey.mozilla.com/s3/Give-feedback-landing-page" is broken in French because it doesn't warn the user that the survey is temporarily disabled. Anyway...

So!

title: Firefox has replaced the history, toolbar settings and favorites on my desktop with those on my laptop. How do I reset to those that were on my desktop?
content: Firefox has replaced the history, toolbar settings and favorites on my desktop with those on my laptop. How do I reset to those that were on my desktop?
creator: don_brink

title: 400 bad request
content: 400 bad request is the message I get when trying to open some news stories. Sometimes if I come back to it later it will open. I have no problem opening these stories using Safari but I hate Safari and would prefer to use Firefox but it is a severe annoyance to not be able to read the information I want to read.
creator: marmick61

title: trouble logging on to credit union online banking
content: I have always been able to access my credit union' online banking website. Now I cannot log in and I get no error message. I'm using firefox 84.0.
creator: todd.s.ellsworth

title: NEW SYNC ISSUES WITH THE NEW POLICY
content:
Total BS. I'm trying to sync my Firefox account to my new install of Windows 10 and I'm getting a message to sign in on another device for sync to work. I'm signed into at least 10 devices at the moment and sync doesn't work. WTF Mozilla are you trying to get rid of your customers, there are plenty of good browsers out there like Chrome so no one needs to put up with this kind of crap. Fix sync or I'll be glad to uninstall Firefox, which btw I've been using almost since its inception. You coding people are always looking for ways to make things difficult and I for one am not going to put up with this nonsense. FIX SYNC AND DUMP THAT SECOND DEVICE CRAP.

With the utmost sincerity

Pamela K James
creator: krissyfl

title: I have 2 installs of FIREFOX on my PC
content: I have 2 installs on my PC; one in program files folder, the other in program files (x86). I think they are both 64 bit. I went to try and uninstall one of the installs in the windows 10 apps uninstall list but I only see it listed once so I did not want to uninstall there. It is possible that onedrive syncing caused this when I somehow activated that setting. Can someone help me rectify this? Thank you in advance.
creator: paulwwiesner

title: Location Services - Novel Latency Problem
content:
Hello everyone,

Firefox 84.0 - fresh windows 10 format w/latest KB4592438

I experience intermittent packet loss and ping spikes upon authorization for Firefox to offer Location Services to websites like Hulu, BLS in-person skill courses, or shopping pages for stores like Target. I cannot recreate my network problems outside of this case and the issue persists long after I leave the involved webpages. Only closing Firefox restores my connectivity, while only Location Services is my only way of recreating the issue.

Thus, I open Hulu and experience high latency for however long until I close Firefox. But if I open Hulu followed by terminating the process and restoring my session, the network problem is resolved. What could possibly cause this? Why do I need to close and reopen firefox again and again to resolve connectivity problems?

I look forward to any recommendations. Please feel free ask for any further details.
creator: Durandal1707

title: Firefox 84 - Problems with Gemalto Smart Card Reader and Crypto Module
content:
Hi,

Since the FF 84 upgrade, FF crashes whenever I try to access certificates from a smart card reader. The smart card reader uses Gemalto classic client 7.3 security modules. The security device is loaded in FF and the installations has worked perfectly well with previous versions of FF (up to version 83). Since the upgrade however, FF repeatedly freezes and ultimately crashes when the smart card is present! If I unload the security device or of the smart card reader is not physically present, FF seems to work correctly.

Does anybody experience the same problems? Somebody has found a solution?

Many thanks in advance for your return. JBL
creator: fz0ms6s84t9m

title: Firefox travando
content: O Firefox, nas versões anteriores, demorava um pouco para abrir o acesso ao certificado digital (token GD Burti - Certsign), porém na última atualização (84.0), assim que insiro o certificao digital na USB, o Firefox trava, e n ada do que se faça (inclusive desinstalar cadeias de certificados ou coisa semelhante) resolve o problema.
creator: Laurikruger

title: close firefox & thunderbird
content: I can not open or close both Firefox and Thunderbird in Windows 10. When I try to open either one I get an error message saying they are running and to close them. No matter what I do I can not close them. And I can not delete them as I get the error message "a program is running or folder is in use - close the program" I can not close either Firefox or Thunderbird or get them to start. I have shut down the PC and did a complete fresh restart but problem is still there - neither will open because they are still running and I can not close them. I have never had this problem before. I also ran my antivirus program and it found nothing. Doing a hold down Shift button does not work either. Using Task manager shown that Firefox is running but ending task does not do anything. There other sites on the net saying to do it DOS but I not sure to do so. Can someone help me? I do not know if I can get your message or not, but thanks anyway.
creator: rmarasi

title: allowed
content: allowed
creator: rawza.enterprise

title: Check updates for endless time
content: I have a problem with firefox 84.0 (64bits) used with windows 7pro. During a restart it works the first time you open it. If I want to use it later without restarting it goes around in circles it checks for updates for an endless time
creator: kohlerwilly

title: Leseszeichen Ordner
content: Lesezeichen Ordner sindverschwunden beziehungsweise leer?
creator: gert.hofer.eisenach

title: Text in input boxes is often white on white background
content:
Since updating to macOS Big Sur, I noticed that on some websites I can't see the text I'm typing into input fields. It appears as white text on a white background, only when I select it, I can see it. The weird thing is that it doesn't happen on every website.

The problem occurs on websites when I'm using the macOS Dark Mode. But when I switch to Light Mode, the problem actually becomes worse and the address bar also becomes illegible.

I've already tried refreshing Firefox but that didn't help.
creator: timo_browsing

title: Som ficou baixo e enrolado depois da ultima atualização
content: Depois que realizei a última atualização do Mozilla meu som, ficou baixo e estranho (tipo enrolado), somente quando utilizou o Microfone para enviar alguma mensagem de áudio pelo WhatsApp.
creator: thiagosantos.unesp

title: Can't see reader's comments in my favorite newspaper
content: I read the newspaper La Nacion La Nacion. Most stories have readers comments. See for example [for example]. I don't see them. If I use Safari or Chrome, I have no problem seeing the comments. Using Mac OS 10.15.7 (Catalina) and Firefox version 84. I suppose that it is a privacy configuration. I have tried everything but to no avail. Thanks in advance for help. Francisco
creator: fahirsch

title: Encrypted SNI  failed to be enabled
content:
Hello,

currently i am trying to enable DOH and Encrypted SNI but i can see that both are not enabled kindly advise

Below what are done from my side

For the DOH

Open your Firefox Preferences page Under Network Settings, select Settings Check Enable DNS over HTTPS"Cloudfare selected" I put cloud fare ip address on my PC DNS setting


For the ESNI i did the below about:config; Type network.security.esni.enabled Select the toggle button to the right of false to true

Regards,
creator: mohamed.aboualy

title: klávesové zkratky
content:
Ahoj,

mám dvě otázky ohledně krávesových zkratek.

(1) Nemůžu nikde dohledat, jak editovat existující klávesové zkratky. Existují nějaké rozšíření, která umožňují vytvářet nové, ale já bych chtěl deaktivovat už existující.

Dočetl jsem se, že to firefox prostě neumožňuje, jenomže například google na svých stránkách používá také klávesové zkratky, například u překladače ctrl+shift+s prohodí jazyk zdrojový s cílovým. Potom to vypadá tak, že se použijí obě zkratky jak na google webu, tak na firefoxu.

Tím, že se to internetových stránek začínají zavádět zkratky se z nemožnosti editace stává regulérní bug.

(2) A druhá otázka: když na těch samých stránkách (translator.google.com) použiju tu samou klávesovou zkratku ctrl+shift+s, tak mám možnost vyfotit část stránky, ale v translatoru se mi prohodí jazyky. Jak vynutím ve firefoxu, aby se na stránkách zkratky nevykonávaly? Tedy že se provede jen to focení stránky ve firefoxu.

Tohle je ten samý problém, jako v dotazu 1, jen se v něm na to dívám z druhého pohledu. Je to možná ještě víc bug net v otázce 1, protože tady mi klávesová zkratka přímo mění internetové stránky.

P.S. Doufám, že není pravda že firefox tyto možnosti zcela zazdil....

title: blocage par "nouvel utilitaire"
content:
Bonjour (I hope an answer in french...)

Sur un MacBook Pro de 2018, MacOS 10.13.6, Firefox 84.0, j'ai deux sessions : "zadmin" est administrateur, "Dominique" ne l'est pas.

Dans la session "zadmin", Firefox fonctionne parfaitement.

Dans la session "Dominique", à chaque démarrage, une fenêtre "Firefox tente d'installer un nouvel utilitaire" (voir capture) m'impose de donner le nom et le mot de passe administrateur : quand je le fais et que je valide, la fenêtre disparaît et plus rien ne se passe (l'écran reste sur Finder, pas de point noir sous Firefox en bas) ! Donc impossible de démarrer Firefox dans cette session.

Que puis-je faire ?

D'avance merci pour votre prochaine réponse et bonnes fêtes Bernard DANGELZER

title: Installed previous version but FF keeps updating
content:
FF 84 (latest version) seems to have a bug which prevents saving multiple images at once. I decided to go back to version 82. I did NOT install the maintenance service (which would handle updates in background). First time I went to the "about" popup to check the version. Big mistake: by default "automatically install updates" is checked in settings, so next time I run FF version 84 will be installed and run instead of 82. OK, no problem, I don't go check in the "about" popup, but go to settings first to disable automatic updates. Now under updates "automatically install updates" is the default, and indeed, just opening settings causes FF to begin downloading the update. There is a way out: you can discard the update.

I understand Mozilla would recommend to update to the latest version, but what you have to do and consider not to is way worse than Microsoft ever was. I would suggest to at least make "check for updates but let you choose to install them" the default. The way it is now is not what I would call user-friendly.

title: Google "Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue"
content:
After the google outage a week ago I can't get into any google site. I asked a friend that also uses firefox and they can access them just fine, I can enter normally with other browsers, too.

Here's a transcript of the error page, if it helps:

Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue

Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to www.youtube.com because this website requires a secure connection.

What can you do about it?

www.youtube.com has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You can’t add an exception to visit this site.

The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it.

If you are on a corporate network or using anti-virus software, you can reach out to the support teams for assistance. You can also notify the website’s administrator about the problem.
